conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of Object A and Object B to determine when they are farthest apart.
Object A's velocity-time graph is shown in the diagram.
Object B's velocity-time graph is also shown in the diagram.
Object A starts with a velocity of v0 and decelerates to 0 over time t1.
Object B starts with a velocity of v0 and accelerates to 0 over time t2.
At t1, Object A has reached its minimum velocity of 0.
At t2, Object B has reached its minimum velocity of 0.
At t1, the distance between Object A and Object B is 0 because they are at the same location.
At t2, the distance between Object A and Object B is 0 because they are at the same location.
At t1 and t2, the two objects are farthest apart.
